channel.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
channel.description:
No question that Half-Life 2 is starting to show it's age (although I think the facial animations have yet to be surpassed by another game, mind you I haven't played many of the newer games), but as I was browsing Kotaku's numerous columns on Half-Life 2 I noticed their take on FFv9.5 and after watching the video was suitably impressed (moreso over the upgrades in the environments, not so much by the npc models, some of which are abhorred).
I'm wondering if anyone here is running v9.5 and can tell me whether or not it's worth a download. Another question is whether or not you can choose what you want upgraded (eg. The option to only have the environments updated and have the npc models remain the same).
I'll link to the Kotaku article for anyone who isn't familiar with the mod (there's a video montage of the upgrades).
[url]https://kotaku.com/5127002/half+life-2s-graphics-dragged-kicking--screaming-into-2009[/url]

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Thanks for link, dude.

Read full topic
item.source: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: popsUlfr
item.description:
InterloperX:

I was under the impression that the authour of FF merely ripped the Batman Begins or Dark Knight soundtracks and substituted that music.

I couldn’t tell for sure. They’re remixes and may bear some resemblances with popular music pieces though.

InterloperX:

It’s a bleedin’ massive download, and you might be just as well waiting for version 10, as it sounds like it will be available for download in the not too distant future.

https://halflife2.filefront.com/file/FakeFactory_Cinematic_Mod_v95;96843

FakeFactory: Cinematic Mod 10 Beta 1 has already been out for some time. ( I suggest the torrent from “Tjingsted”. It’s really fast)
I’ve tried it and it worked flawlessly (at least with the original Valve Models). The thing that still irks me is that some scenes in Half-Life 2 are screwed up in one way or another. (the teleporter’s “thingies” not rotating anymore, or Breen just turning his head when appearing in his office. The trains in “Route Kanal” not coming anymore…). But Half-Life 2 in the Orange Box engine looks great nonetheless

Read full topic

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: popsUlfr
item.description:
Level:

Is all the music in CM 9.5 very orchestra and slow, or do they have some faster bits for more exciting sequences?

The Soundtrack is pretty Epic and “Very Orchestral”, there are some faster ones though. The first thing I did was replace them with the Original anyway , but I think I will give v10 a chance and a playthrough (the author invested much work into making the game a dynamic audio experience)

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: Steppenwolf
item.description:
Master Chef:

HL IS[/SIZE] cartoony/absurd in almost every way.

I do not think you know what “cartoony” does mean.

Read full topic
item.source: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Master Chef:

Well, yes, I always thought the GRAPHICS were REALISTIC (excluding gibs).

Storytelling without cutscenes was REALISTIC.

Blowing your way through an armored battalion of marines was NOT REALISTIC.

I think that basically sums up my argument.

Presentation: Very Realistic
Gameplay: Not so much

Which also basically sums up 80% of FPS. Congrats, you just made a general statement.

Read full topic
item.source: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?

Well, yes, I always thought the GRAPHICS were REALISTIC (excluding gibs).

Storytelling without cutscenes was REALISTIC.

Blowing your way through an armored battalion of marines was NOT REALISTIC.

I think that basically sums up my argument.

Presentation: Very Realistic
Gameplay: Not so much

In which case I’ll agree.

item.source: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: InterloperX
item.description:
Well, here we go, aside from the original Rainbow Six Ghost Recon games, I don’t think many games since have aspired to that level of realism in a game, and even then being jumped to the next surviving squad member took it out of the realism element.

You can only take realism in gameplay so far before it becomes a completely frustrating clusterfuck. (read: Call of Duty series and random recharging health level).

Read full topic

item.title: Fake Factory v9.5 Is it Worth a Download?
item.dc:creator: Eric_Fong
item.description:
Master Chef:

What about a geeky white dude in a flourescent orange HAZMAT suit running around clubbing aliens with crowbars and capping Special Forces soldiers with an M4, careening wildly through Top Secret Science Labs and Alien Robot Towers, absorbing thousands of bullets and shooting cars with gravity-manipulating guns is not cartoony.

That is too troll for me.
